description: Assigns a symbolic name to an address match list.
name: acl

description: Defines the algorithm to be used in a key clause.
name: algorithm

description: Limits UDP responses of all kinds.
name: all-per-second

description: Controls the ability to add zones at runtime via rndc addzone.
name: allow-new-zones

description: Defines an address_match_list that is allowed to send NOTIFY messages for the zone, in addition to addresses defined in the primaries option for the zone.
name: allow-notify

description: Specifies which hosts (an IP address list) are allowed to send queries to this resolver.
name: allow-query

description: Specifies which hosts (an IP address list) can access this server's cache and thus effectively controls recursion.
name: allow-query-cache

description: Specifies which hosts (an IP address list) can access this server's cache. Used on servers with multiple interfaces.
name: allow-query-cache-on

description: Specifies which local addresses (an IP address list) are allowed to send queries to this resolver. Used in multi-homed configurations.
name: allow-query-on

description: Defines an address_match_list of clients that are allowed to perform recursive queries.
name: allow-recursion

description: Specifies which local addresses can accept recursive queries.
name: allow-recursion-on

description: Defines an address_match_list of hosts that are allowed to transfer the zone information from this server.
name: allow-transfer

description: Defines an address_match_list of hosts that are allowed to submit dynamic updates for primary zones.
name: allow-update

description: Defines an address_match_list of hosts that are allowed to submit dynamic updates to a secondary server for transmission to a primary.
name: allow-update-forwarding

description: Defines one or more hosts that are sent NOTIFY messages when zone changes occur.
grammar: also-notify [ port <integer> ]  { ( <remote-servers> | <ipv4_address> [ port <integer> ] | <ipv6_address> [ port <integer> ] ) [ key <string> ] [ tls <string> ]; ... };
name: also-notify

description: Defines alternate local IPv4 address(es) to be used by the server for inbound zone transfers, if the address(es) defined by transfer-source fail and use-alt-transfer-source is enabled.
name: alt-transfer-source

description: Defines alternate local IPv6 address(es) to be used by the server for inbound zone transfers.
name: alt-transfer-source-v6

description: Controls whether COOKIE EDNS replies are sent in response to client queries.
name: answer-cookie

description: Allows multiple views to share a single cache database.
name: attach-cache

description: Controls whether BIND, acting as a resolver, provides authoritative NXDOMAIN (domain does not exist) answers.
name: auth-nxdomain

description: Permits varying levels of automatic DNSSEC key management.
name: auto-dnssec

description: Controls the automatic rescanning of network interfaces when addresses are added or removed.
name: automatic-interface-scan

description: Specifies the range(s) of ports to be excluded from use as sources for UDP/IPv4 messages.
name: avoid-v4-udp-ports

description: Specifies the range(s) of ports to be excluded from use as sources for UDP/IPv6 messages.
name: avoid-v6-udp-ports

description: Specifies the pathname of a file to override the built-in trusted keys provided by named.
name: bindkeys-file

description: Defines an address_match_list of hosts to ignore. The server will neither respond to queries from nor send queries to these addresses.
name: blackhole

description: Allows a remote server to be ignored.
name: bogus

description: Enables dns64 synthesis even if the validated result would cause a DNSSEC validation failure.
name: break-dnssec

description: Controls flushing of log messages.
name: buffered

description: Specifies the path to a file containing TLS certificates for trusted CA authorities, used to verify remote peer certificates.
name: ca-file

description: Configures catalog zones in named.conf.
name: catalog-zones

description: Specifies the type of data logged to a particular channel.
name: category

description: Specifies the path to a file containing the TLS certificate for a connection.
name: cert-file

description: Defines a stream of data that can be independently logged.
name: channel

description: Checks primary zones for records that are treated as different by DNSSEC but are semantically equal in plain DNS.
name: check-dup-records

description: Performs post-load zone integrity checks on primary zones.
name: check-integrity

description: Checks whether an MX record appears to refer to an IP address.
name: check-mx

description: Sets the response to MX records that refer to CNAMEs.
name: check-mx-cname

description: Restricts the character set and syntax of certain domain names in primary files and/or DNS responses received from the network.
name: check-names

description: Specifies whether to check for sibling glue when performing integrity checks.
name: check-sibling

description: Specifies whether to check for a TXT Sender Policy Framework record, if an SPF record is present.
name: check-spf

description: Sets the response to SRV records that refer to CNAMEs.
name: check-srv-cname

description: Checks for non-terminal wildcards.
name: check-wildcard

description: Specifies a list of allowed ciphers.
name: ciphers

description: Specifies an access control list (ACL) of clients that are affected by a given dns64 directive.
name: clients

description: Sets the initial minimum number of simultaneous recursive clients accepted by the server for any given query before the server drops additional clients.
name: clients-per-query

description: Specifies control channels to be used to manage the name server.
name: controls

description: Sets the algorithm to be used when generating a server cookie.
name: cookie-algorithm

description: Specifies a shared secret used for generating and verifying EDNS COOKIE options within an anycast cluster.
name: cookie-secret

description: Sets the maximum size of a core dump.
name: coresize

description: Specifies the type of database to be used to store zone data.
name: database

description: Sets the maximum amount of data memory that can be used by the server.
name: datasize

description: Indicates that a forward, hint, or stub zone is to be treated as a delegation-only type zone.
name: delegation-only

description: Rejects A or AAAA records if the corresponding IPv4 or IPv6 addresses match a given address_match_list.
name: deny-answer-addresses

description: Rejects CNAME or DNAME records if the "alias" name matches a given list of domain_name elements.
name: deny-answer-aliases

description: Specifies the path to a file containing Diffie-Hellman parameters, for enabling cipher suites.
name: dhparam-file

description: Concentrates zone maintenance so that all transfers take place once every heartbeat-interval, ideally during a single call.
name: dialup

description: Sets the server's working directory.
name: directory

description: Disables DNSSEC algorithms from a specified zone.
name: disable-algorithms

description: Disables DS digest types from a specified zone.
name: disable-ds-digests

description: Disables individual empty zones.
name: disable-empty-zone

description: Configures a Dynamically Loadable Zone (DLZ) database in named.conf.
name: dlz

description: Instructs named to return mapped IPv4 addresses to AAAA queries when there are no AAAA records.
name: dns64

description: Specifies the name of the contact for dns64 zones.
name: dns64-contact

description: Specifies the name of the server for dns64 zones.
name: dns64-server

description: Specifies the number of days in the future when automatically generated DNSSEC signatures expire.
name: dnskey-sig-validity

description: Specifies the time to live (TTL) for DNSKEY resource records.
name: dnskey-ttl

description: Turns on the DNS Response Policy Service (DNSRPS) interface.
name: dnsrps-enable

description: Provides additional RPZ configuration settings, which are passed to the DNS Response Policy Service (DNSRPS) provider library.
name: dnsrps-options

description: Instructs BIND 9 to accept expired DNSSEC signatures when validating.
name: dnssec-accept-expired

description: Specifies that only key-signing keys are used to sign the DNSKEY, CDNSKEY, and CDS RRsets at a zone's apex.
name: dnssec-dnskey-kskonly

description: Sets the frequency of automatic checks of the DNSSEC key repository.
name: dnssec-loadkeys-interval

description: Defines hierarchies that must or may not be secure (signed and validated).
name: dnssec-must-be-secure

description: Defines a key and signing policy (KASP) for zones.
name: dnssec-policy

description: Allows a dynamic zone to transition from secure to insecure by deleting all DNSKEY records.
name: dnssec-secure-to-insecure

description: Controls the scheduled maintenance of DNSSEC signatures.
name: dnssec-update-mode

description: Enables DNSSEC validation in named.
name: dnssec-validation

description: Enables logging of dnstap messages.
grammar: dnstap { ( all | auth | client | forwarder | resolver | update ) [ ( query | response ) ]; ... };
name: dnstap

description: Specifies an identity string to send in dnstap messages.
name: dnstap-identity

description: Configures the path to which the dnstap frame stream is sent.
grammar: dnstap-output ( file | unix ) <quoted_string> [ size ( unlimited | <size> ) ] [ versions ( unlimited | <integer> ) ] [ suffix ( increment | timestamp ) ];
name: dnstap-output

description: Specifies a version string to send in dnstap messages.
name: dnstap-version

description: Sets the Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value (obsolete).
name: dscp

description: Specifies host names or addresses of machines with access to both IPv4 and IPv6 transports.
name: dual-stack-servers

description: Indicates the pathname of the file where the server dumps the database after rndc dumpdb.
name: dump-file

description: Configures a DynDB database in named.conf.
name: dyndb

description: Controls the use of the EDNS0 (RFC 2671) feature.
name: edns

description: Sets the maximum advertised EDNS UDP buffer size to control the size of packets received from authoritative servers in response to recursive queries.
name: edns-udp-size

description: Sets the maximum EDNS VERSION that is sent to the server(s) by the resolver.
name: edns-version

description: Specifies the contact name in the returned SOA record for empty zones.
name: empty-contact

description: Specifies the server name in the returned SOA record for empty zones.
name: empty-server

description: Enables or disables all empty zones.
name: empty-zones-enable

description: Specifies a list of HTTP query paths on which to listen.
name: endpoints

description: Limits the number of errors for a valid domain name and record type.
name: errors-per-second

description: Allows a list of IPv6 addresses to be ignored if they appear in a domain name's AAAA records in dns64.
name: exclude

description: Exempts specific clients or client groups from rate limiting.
name: exempt-clients

description: Sets the parameters for dynamic resizing of the fetches-per-server quota in response to detected congestion.
name: fetch-quota-params

description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous iterative queries allowed to be sent by a server to an upstream name server before the server blocks additional queries.
name: fetches-per-server

description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous iterative queries allowed to any one domain before the server blocks new queries for data in or beneath that zone.
name: fetches-per-zone

description: Specifies the zone's filename.
name: file

description: Sets the maximum number of files the server may have open concurrently.
name: files

description: Controls whether pending zone writes are flushed when the name server exits.
name: flush-zones-on-shutdown

description: Allows or disallows fallback to recursion if forwarding has failed; it is always used in conjunction with the forwarders statement.
name: forward

description: Defines one or more hosts to which queries are forwarded.
name: forwarders

description: Sets the number of accumulated bytes in the output buffer before forcing a buffer flush.
name: fstrm-set-buffer-hint

description: Sets the number of seconds that unflushed data remains in the output buffer.
name: fstrm-set-flush-timeout

description: Sets the number of queue entries to allocate for each input queue.
name: fstrm-set-input-queue-size

description: Sets the number of outstanding queue entries allowed on an input queue before waking the I/O thread.
name: fstrm-set-output-notify-threshold

description: Sets the queuing semantics to use for queue objects.
name: fstrm-set-output-queue-model

description: Sets the number of queue entries allocated for each output queue.
name: fstrm-set-output-queue-size

description: Sets the number of seconds to wait between attempts to reopen a closed output stream.
name: fstrm-set-reopen-interval

description: Specifies the directory containing GeoIP database files.
name: geoip-directory

description: Deprecated.
name: glue-cache

description: Sets the interval at which the server performs zone maintenance tasks for all zones marked as dialup.
name: heartbeat-interval

description: Specifies the hostname of the server to return in response to a hostname.bind query.
name: hostname

description: Configures HTTP endpoints on which to listen for DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) queries.
name: http

description: Limits the number of active concurrent connections on a per-listener basis.
name: http-listener-clients

description: Specifies the TCP port number the server uses to receive and send unencrypted DNS traffic via HTTP.
name: http-port

description: Limits the number of active concurrent HTTP/2 streams on a per-connection basis.
name: http-streams-per-connection

description: Specifies the TCP port number the server uses to receive and send DNS-over-HTTPS protocol traffic.
name: https-port

description: Specifies the view in which a given zone is defined.
name: in-view

description: Specifies a TCP socket as a control channel.
name: inet

description: Specifies whether BIND 9 maintains a separate signed version of a zone.
name: inline-signing

description: Sets the interval at which the server scans the network interface list.
name: interface-interval

description: Specifies the prefix lengths of IPv4 address blocks.
name: ipv4-prefix-length

description: Specifies the contact for the IPV4ONLY.ARPA zone created by dns64.
name: ipv4only-contact

description: Enables automatic IPv4 zones if a dns64 block is configured.
name: ipv4only-enable

description: Specifies the name of the server for the IPV4ONLY.ARPA zone created by dns64.
name: ipv4only-server

description: Specifies the prefix lengths of IPv6 address blocks.
name: ipv6-prefix-length

description: Controls how IXFR transfers are calculated.
name: ixfr-from-differences

description: Allows the default journal's filename to be overridden.
name: journal

description: Defines an address_match_list of addresses which do not accept reordered answers within a single TCP stream.
name: keep-response-order

description: Defines a shared secret key for use with TSIG or the command channel.
name: key

description: Indicates the directory where public and private DNSSEC key files are found.
name: key-directory

description: Specifies the path to a file containing the private TLS key for a connection.
name: key-file

description: Specifies one or more server_key s to be used with a remote server.
name: keys

description: Sets the resolver's lame cache.
name: lame-ttl

description: Specifies the IPv4 addresses on which a server listens for DNS queries.
grammar: listen-on [ port <integer> ] [ tls <string> ] [ http <string> ] { <address_match_element>; ... }; // may occur multiple times
name: listen-on

description: Specifies the IPv6 addresses on which a server listens for DNS queries.
grammar: listen-on-v6 [ port <integer> ] [ tls <string> ] [ http <string> ] { <address_match_element>; ... }; // may occur multiple times
name: listen-on-v6

description: Specifies a per-listener quota for active connections.
name: listener-clients

description: Sets a maximum size for the memory map of the new-zone database in LMDB database format.
name: lmdb-mapsize

description: Sets the pathname of the file on which named attempts to acquire a file lock when starting for the first time.
name: lock-file

description: Tests rate-limiting parameters without actually dropping any requests.
name: log-only

description: Configures logging options for the name server.
name: logging

description: Deprecated, use trust-anchors.
grammar: managed-keys { <string> ( static-key | initial-key | static-ds | initial-ds ) <integer> <integer> <integer> <quoted_string>; ... }; // may occur multiple times, deprecated
name: managed-keys

description: Specifies the directory in which to store the files that track managed DNSSEC keys.
name: managed-keys-directory

description: Specifies an access control list (ACL) of IPv4 addresses that are to be mapped to the corresponding A RRset in dns64.
name: mapped

description: Specifies the file format of zone files.
name: masterfile-format

description: Specifies the format of zone files during a dump, when the masterfile-format is text.
name: masterfile-style

description: Specifies a view of DNS namespace for a given subset of client IP addresses.
name: match-clients

description: Specifies a view of DNS namespace for a given subset of destination IP addresses.
name: match-destinations

description: Allows IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses to match address-match list entries for corresponding IPv4 addresses.
name: match-mapped-addresses

description: Specifies that only recursive requests can match this view of the DNS namespace.
name: match-recursive-only

description: Sets the maximum amount of memory to use for an individual cache database and its associated metadata.
name: max-cache-size

description: Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) that the server caches ordinary (positive) answers.
name: max-cache-ttl

description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous recursive clients accepted by the server for any given query before the server drops additional clients.
name: max-clients-per-query

description: Sets the maximum size for IXFR responses to zone transfer requests.
name: max-ixfr-ratio

description: Controls the size of journal files.
name: max-journal-size

description: Specifies the maximum retention time (in seconds) for storage of negative answers in the server's cache.
name: max-ncache-ttl

description: Sets the maximum number of records permitted in a zone.
name: max-records

description: Sets the maximum number of levels of recursion permitted at any one time while servicing a recursive query.
name: max-recursion-depth

description: Sets the maximum number of iterative queries while servicing a recursive query.
name: max-recursion-queries

description: Limits the zone refresh interval to no less often than the specified value, in seconds.
name: max-refresh-time

description: Limits the zone refresh retry interval to no less often than the specified value, in seconds.
name: max-retry-time

description: Sets the maximum RSA exponent size (in bits) when validating.
name: max-rsa-exponent-size

description: Specifies the maximum time that the server retains records past their normal expiry, to return them as stale records.
name: max-stale-ttl

description: Sets the maximum size of the table used to track requests and rate-limit responses.
name: max-table-size

description: Specifies the number of minutes after which inbound zone transfers making no progress are terminated.
name: max-transfer-idle-in

description: Specifies the number of minutes after which outbound zone transfers making no progress are terminated.
name: max-transfer-idle-out

description: Specifies the number of minutes after which inbound zone transfers are terminated.
name: max-transfer-time-in

description: Specifies the number of minutes after which outbound zone transfers are terminated.
name: max-transfer-time-out

description: Sets the maximum EDNS UDP message size sent by named.
name: max-udp-size

description: Specifies a maximum permissible time-to-live (TTL) value, in seconds.
name: max-zone-ttl

description: Controls whether memory statistics are written to the file specified by memstatistics-file at exit.
name: memstatistics

description: Sets the pathname of the file where the server writes memory usage statistics on exit.
name: memstatistics-file

description: Controls whether DNS name compression is used in responses to regular queries.
name: message-compression

description: Specifies the minimum time (in seconds) that the server caches ordinary (positive) answers.
name: min-cache-ttl

description: Specifies the minimum retention time (in seconds) for storage of negative answers in the server's cache.
name: min-ncache-ttl

description: Limits the zone refresh interval to no more often than the specified value, in seconds.
name: min-refresh-time

description: Limits the zone refresh retry interval to no more often than the specified value, in seconds.
name: min-retry-time

description: Sets the minimum size of the table used to track requests and rate-limit responses.
name: min-table-size

description: Controls whether the server replies with only one of the RRsets for a query name, when generating a positive response to a query of type ANY over UDP.
name: minimal-any

description: Controls whether the server only adds records to the authority and additional data sections when they are required (e.g. delegations, negative responses). This improves server performance.
name: minimal-responses

description: Controls whether serial number mismatch errors are logged.
name: multi-master

description: Specifies the directory where configuration parameters are stored for zones added by rndc addzone.
name: new-zones-directory

description: Specifies a list of addresses that require case-insensitive compression in responses.
name: no-case-compress

description: Sets the maximum size of UDP responses that are sent to queries without a valid server COOKIE.
name: nocookie-udp-size

description: Limits the number of empty (NODATA) responses for a valid domain name.
name: nodata-per-second

description: Controls whether NOTIFY messages are sent on zone changes.
name: notify

description: Sets the delay (in seconds) between sending sets of NOTIFY messages for a zone.
name: notify-delay

description: Specifies the rate at which NOTIFY requests are sent during normal zone maintenance operations.
name: notify-rate

description: Defines the IPv4 address (and optional port) to be used for outgoing NOTIFY messages.
name: notify-source

description: Defines the IPv6 address (and optional port) to be used for outgoing NOTIFY messages.
name: notify-source-v6

description: Controls whether the name servers in the NS RRset are checked against the SOA MNAME.
name: notify-to-soa

description: Specifies the use of NSEC3 instead of NSEC, and sets NSEC3 parameters.
name: nsec3param

description: Specifies the lifetime, in seconds, for negative trust anchors added via rndc nta.
name: nta-lifetime

description: Specifies the time interval for checking whether negative trust anchors added via rndc nta are still necessary.
name: nta-recheck

description: Causes all messages sent to the logging channel to be discarded.
name: null

description: Appends the specified suffix to the original query name, when replacing an NXDOMAIN with a redirect namespace.
name: nxdomain-redirect

description: Limits the number of undefined subdomains for a valid domain name.
name: nxdomains-per-second

description: Defines global options to be used by BIND 9.
name: options

description: Adds EDNS Padding options to outgoing messages to increase the packet size.
name: padding

description: Sets the time to live (TTL) of the DS RRset used by the parent zone.
name: parent-ds-ttl

description: Sets the propagation delay from the time the parent zone is updated to when the new version is served by all of the parent zone's name servers.
name: parent-propagation-delay

description: Defines a list of delegation agents to be used by primary and secondary zones.
name: parental-agents

description: Specifies which local IPv4 source address is used to send parental DS queries.
name: parental-source

description: Specifies which local IPv6 source address is used to send parental DS queries.
name: parental-source-v6

description: Specifies the pathname of the file where the server writes its process ID.
name: pid-file

description: Configures plugins in named.conf.
name: plugin

description: Specifies the UDP/TCP port number the server uses to receive and send DNS protocol traffic.
name: port

description: Specifies that server ciphers should be preferred over client ones.
name: prefer-server-ciphers

description: Controls the order of glue records in an A or AAAA response.
name: preferred-glue

description: Specifies the "trigger" time-to-live (TTL) value at which prefetch of the current query takes place.
name: prefetch

description: Defines one or more primary servers for a zone.
name: primaries

description: Includes the category in log messages.
name: print-category

description: Includes the severity in log messages.
name: print-severity

description: Specifies the time format for log messages.
name: print-time

description: Specifies the allowed versions of the TLS protocol.
name: protocols

description: Controls whether a primary responds to an incremental zone request (IXFR) or only responds with a full zone transfer (AXFR).
name: provide-ixfr

description: Increases the amount of time between when keys are published and when they become active, to allow for unforeseen events.
name: publish-safety

description: Specifies the amount of time after which DNSSEC keys that have been deleted from the zone can be removed from disk.
name: purge-keys

description: Controls QNAME minimization behavior in the BIND 9 resolver.
name: qname-minimization

description: Tightens defenses during DNS attacks by scaling back the ratio of the current query-per-second rate.
name: qps-scale

description: Controls the IPv4 address from which queries are issued.
name: query-source

description: Controls the IPv6 address from which queries are issued.
name: query-source-v6

description: Specifies whether query logging should be active when named first starts.
name: querylog

description: Controls excessive UDP responses, to prevent BIND 9 from being used to amplify reflection denial-of-service (DoS) attacks.
name: rate-limit

description: Specifies the pathname of the file where the server dumps queries that are currently recursing via rndc recursing.
name: recursing-file

description: Defines whether recursion and caching are allowed.
name: recursion

description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent recursive queries the server can perform.
name: recursive-clients

description: Toggles whether dns64 synthesis occurs only for recursive queries.
name: recursive-only

description: Limits the number of referrals or delegations to a server for a given domain.
name: referrals-per-second

description: Specifies the expected hostname in the TLS certificate of the remote server.
name: remote-hostname

description: Specifies whether the local server requests the EDNS EXPIRE value, when acting as a secondary.
name: request-expire

description: Controls whether a secondary requests an incremental zone transfer (IXFR) or a full zone transfer (AXFR).
name: request-ixfr

description: Controls whether an empty EDNS(0) NSID (Name Server Identifier) option is sent with all queries to authoritative name servers during iterative resolution.
name: request-nsid

description: Controls whether a valid server cookie is required before sending a full response to a UDP request.
name: require-server-cookie

description: Deprecated.
name: reserved-sockets

description: Specifies the number of retries before exponential backoff.
name: resolver-nonbackoff-tries

description: Specifies the length of time, in milliseconds, that a resolver attempts to resolve a recursive query before failing.
name: resolver-query-timeout

description: Sets the base retry interval (in milliseconds).
name: resolver-retry-interval

description: Adds an EDNS Padding option to encrypted messages, to reduce the chance of guessing the contents based on size.
name: response-padding

description: Specifies response policy zones for the view or among global options.
grammar: response-policy { zone <string> [ add-soa <boolean> ] [ log <boolean> ] [ max-policy-ttl <duration> ] [ min-update-interval <duration> ] [ policy ( cname | disabled | drop | given | no-op | nodata | nxdomain | passthru | tcp-only <quoted_string> ) ] [ recursive-only <boolean> ] [ nsip-enable <boolean> ] [ nsdname-enable <boolean> ]; ... } [ add-soa <boolean> ] [ break-dnssec <boolean> ] [ max-policy-ttl <duration> ] [ min-update-interval <duration> ] [ min-ns-dots <integer> ] [ nsip-wait-recurse <boolean> ] [ nsdname-wait-recurse <boolean> ] [ qname-wait-recurse <boolean> ] [ recursive-only <boolean> ] [ nsip-enable <boolean> ] [ nsdname-enable <boolean> ] [ dnsrps-enable <boolean> ] [ dnsrps-options { <unspecified-text> } ];
name: response-policy

description: Limits the number of non-empty responses for a valid domain name and record type.
name: responses-per-second

description: Increases the amount of time a key remains published after it is no longer active, to allow for unforeseen events.
name: retire-safety

description: Enables kernel load-balancing of sockets.
name: reuseport

description: Turns on enforcement of delegation-only in top-level domains (TLDs) and root zones with an optional exclude list.
name: root-delegation-only

description: Controls whether BIND 9 responds to root key sentinel probes.
name: root-key-sentinel

description: Defines the order in which equal RRs (RRsets) are returned.
name: rrset-order

description: Specifies whether a Dynamically Loadable Zone (DLZ) module is queried for an answer to a query name.
name: search

description: Defines a Base64-encoded string to be used as the secret by the algorithm.
name: secret

description: Specifies the pathname of the file where the server dumps security roots, when using rndc secroots.
name: secroots-file

description: Controls whether a COOKIE EDNS option is sent along with a query.
name: send-cookie

description: Defines an upper limit on the number of queries per second issued by the server, when querying the SOA RRs used for zone transfers.
name: serial-query-rate

description: Specifies the update method to be used for the zone serial number in the SOA record.
name: serial-update-method

description: Defines characteristics to be associated with a remote name server.
name: server

description: Specifies a list of IP addresses to which queries should be sent in recursive resolution for a static-stub zone.
name: server-addresses

description: Specifies the ID of the server to return in response to a ID.SERVER query.
name: server-id

description: Specifies a list of domain names of name servers that act as authoritative servers of a static-stub zone.
name: server-names

description: Sets the length of time (in seconds) that a SERVFAIL response is cached.
name: servfail-ttl

description: Specifies the algorithm to use for the TSIG session key.
name: session-keyalg

description: Specifies the pathname of the file where a TSIG session key is written, when generated by named for use by nsupdate -l.
name: session-keyfile

description: Specifies the key name for the TSIG session key.
name: session-keyname

description: Enables or disables session resumption through TLS session tickets.
name: session-tickets

description: Defines the priority level of log messages.
name: severity

description: Specifies the maximum number of nodes to be examined in each quantum, when signing a zone with a new DNSKEY.
name: sig-signing-nodes

description: Specifies the threshold for the number of signatures that terminates processing a quantum, when signing a zone with a new DNSKEY.
name: sig-signing-signatures

description: Specifies a private RDATA type to use when generating signing-state records.
name: sig-signing-type

description: Specifies the maximum number of days that RRSIGs generated by named are valid.
name: sig-validity-interval

description: Specifies how frequently an RRSIG record is refreshed.
name: signatures-refresh

description: Indicates the validity period of an RRSIG record.
name: signatures-validity

description: Indicates the validity period of DNSKEY records.
name: signatures-validity-dnskey

description: Sets the number of "slipped" responses to minimize the use of forged source addresses for an attack.
name: slip

description: Controls the ordering of RRs returned to the client, based on the client's IP address.
name: sortlist

description: Sets the maximum amount of stack memory that can be used by the server.
name: stacksize

description: Defines the amount of time (in milliseconds) that named waits before attempting to answer a query with a stale RRset from cache.
name: stale-answer-client-timeout

description: Enables the returning of "stale" cached answers when the name servers for a zone are not answering.
name: stale-answer-enable

description: Specifies the time to live (TTL) to be returned on stale answers, in seconds.
name: stale-answer-ttl

description: Enables the retention of "stale" cached answers.
name: stale-cache-enable

description: Sets the time window for the return of "stale" cached answers before the next attempt to contact, if the name servers for a given zone are not responding.
name: stale-refresh-time

description: Specifies the rate at which NOTIFY requests are sent when the name server is first starting, or when new zones have been added.
name: startup-notify-rate

description: Specifies the communication channels to be used by system administrators to access statistics information on the name server.
name: statistics-channels

description: Specifies the pathname of the file where the server appends statistics, when using rndc stats.
name: statistics-file

description: Directs the logging channel output to the server's standard error stream.
name: stderr

description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent HTTP/2 streams over an HTTP/2 connection.
name: streams-per-connection

description: Defines trailing bits for mapped IPv4 address bits in dns64.
name: suffix

description: Enables support for RFC 8198, Aggressive Use of DNSSEC-Validated Cache.
name: synth-from-dnssec

description: Directs the logging channel to the system log.
name: syslog

description: Sets the timeout value (in milliseconds) that the server sends in responses containing the EDNS TCP keepalive option.
name: tcp-advertised-timeout

description: Specifies the maximum number of simultaneous client TCP connections accepted by the server.
name: tcp-clients

description: Sets the amount of time (in milliseconds) that the server waits on an idle TCP connection before closing it, if the EDNS TCP keepalive option is not in use.
name: tcp-idle-timeout

description: Sets the amount of time (in milliseconds) that the server waits on a new TCP connection for the first message from the client.
name: tcp-initial-timeout

description: Adds EDNS TCP keepalive to messages sent over TCP.
name: tcp-keepalive

description: Sets the amount of time (in milliseconds) that the server waits on an idle TCP connection before closing it, if the EDNS TCP keepalive option is in use.
name: tcp-keepalive-timeout

description: Sets the listen-queue depth.
name: tcp-listen-queue

description: Sets the transport protocol to TCP.
name: tcp-only

description: Sets the operating system's receive buffer size for TCP sockets.
name: tcp-receive-buffer

description: Sets the operating system's send buffer size for TCP sockets.
name: tcp-send-buffer

description: Sets the Diffie-Hellman key used by the server to generate shared keys.
name: tkey-dhkey

description: Sets the domain appended to the names of all shared keys generated with TKEY.
name: tkey-domain

description: Sets the security credential for authentication keys requested by the GSS-TSIG protocol.
name: tkey-gssapi-credential

description: Sets the KRB5 keytab file to use for GSS-TSIG updates.
name: tkey-gssapi-keytab

description: Configures a TLS connection.
name: tls

description: Specifies the TCP port number the server uses to receive and send DNS-over-TLS protocol traffic.
name: tls-port

description: Controls whether multiple records can be packed into a message during zone transfers.
name: transfer-format

description: Limits the uncompressed size of DNS messages used in zone transfers over TCP.
name: transfer-message-size

description: Defines which local IPv4 address(es) are bound to TCP connections used to fetch zones transferred inbound by the server.
name: transfer-source

description: Defines which local IPv6 address(es) are bound to TCP connections used to fetch zones transferred inbound by the server.
name: transfer-source-v6

description: Limits the number of concurrent inbound zone transfers from a server.
name: transfers

description: Limits the number of concurrent inbound zone transfers.
name: transfers-in

description: Limits the number of concurrent outbound zone transfers.
name: transfers-out

description: Limits the number of concurrent inbound zone transfers from a remote server.
name: transfers-per-ns

description: Instructs named to send specially formed queries once per day to domains for which trust anchors have been configured.
name: trust-anchor-telemetry

description: Defines DNSSEC trust anchors.
grammar: trust-anchors { <string> ( static-key | initial-key | static-ds | initial-ds ) <integer> <integer> <integer> <quoted_string>; ... }; // may occur multiple times
name: trust-anchors

description: Deprecated, use trust-anchors.
grammar: trusted-keys { <string> <integer> <integer> <integer> <quoted_string>; ... }; // may occur multiple times, deprecated
name: trusted-keys

description: Specifies that BIND 9 should attempt to refresh a zone using TCP if UDP queries fail.
name: try-tcp-refresh

description: Specifies the kind of zone in a given configuration.
name: type

description: Enforces the delegation-only status of infrastructure zones (COM, NET, ORG, etc.).
name: type delegation-only

description: Contains forwarding statements that apply to queries within a given domain.
name: type forward

description: Contains the initial set of root name servers to be used at BIND 9 startup.
name: type hint

description: Contains a DNSSEC-validated duplicate of the main data for a zone.
name: type mirror

description: Contains the main copy of the data for a zone.
name: type primary

description: Contains information to answer queries when normal resolution would return NXDOMAIN.
name: type redirect

description: Contains a duplicate of the data for a zone that has been transferred from a primary server.
name: type secondary

description: Contains a duplicate of the NS records of a primary zone, but statically configured rather than transferred from a primary server.
name: type static-stub

description: Contains a duplicate of the NS records of a primary zone.
name: type stub

description: Sets the operating system's receive buffer size for UDP sockets.
name: udp-receive-buffer

description: Sets the operating system's send buffer size for UDP sockets.
name: udp-send-buffer

description: Specifies a Unix domain socket as a control channel.
grammar: unix <quoted_string> perm <integer> owner <integer> group <integer> [ keys { <string>; ... } ] [ read-only <boolean> ]; // may occur multiple times
name: unix

description: Specifies whether to check the KSK bit to determine how a key should be used, when generating RRSIGs for a secure zone.
name: update-check-ksk

description: Sets fine-grained rules to allow or deny dynamic updates (DDNS), based on requester identity, updated content, etc.
grammar: update-policy ( local | { ( deny | grant ) <string> ( 6to4-self | external | krb5-self | krb5-selfsub | krb5-subdomain | krb5-subdomain-self-rhs | ms-self | ms-selfsub | ms-subdomain | ms-subdomain-self-rhs | name | self | selfsub | selfwild | subdomain | tcp-self | wildcard | zonesub ) [ <string> ] <rrtypelist>; ... } );
name: update-policy

description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent DNS UPDATE messages that can be processed by the server.
name: update-quota

description: Indicates whether alt-transfer-source and alt-transfer-source-v6 can be used.
name: use-alt-transfer-source

description: Specifies a list of ports that are valid sources for UDP/IPv4 messages.
name: use-v4-udp-ports

description: Specifies a list of ports that are valid sources for UDP/IPv6 messages.
name: use-v6-udp-ports

description: Indicates the number of milliseconds of preference to give to IPv6 name servers.
name: v6-bias

description: Specifies a list of domain names at and beneath which DNSSEC validation should not be performed.
name: validate-except

description: Specifies the version number of the server to return in response to a version.bind query.
name: version

description: Allows a name server to answer a DNS query differently depending on who is asking.
name: view

description: Specifies the length of time during which responses are tracked.
name: window

description: Specifies whether to set the time to live (TTL) of the SOA record to zero, when returning authoritative negative responses to SOA queries.
name: zero-no-soa-ttl

description: Sets the time to live (TTL) to zero when caching a negative response to an SOA query.
name: zero-no-soa-ttl-cache

description: Specifies the zone in a BIND 9 configuration.
name: zone

description: Sets the propagation delay from the time a zone is first updated to when the new version of the zone is served by all secondary servers.
name: zone-propagation-delay

description: Controls the level of statistics gathered for all zones.
name: zone-statistics
